Lead.text: 2016-07-07 00:40fileJoffrey, Queen Cersei's sadistic son, ascends the Iron Throne following the death of Robert Baratheon, the Usurper, who won it in battle.
2016-07-07 00:40fileBoth the dour Stannis and the charismatic Renly Baratheon, Robert's brothers, also seek the throne.
2016-07-07 00:40fileRobb Stark, declared King in the North, battles to avenge his father's execution and retrieve his sister from Joffrey's court.
2016-07-07 00:40fileDaenerys, the exiled last heir of the former ruling family, nurtures three dragons and seeks a way home.
2016-07-07 00:40fileLast year when he took ill, the Citadel had sent Pylos out from Oldtown, mere days before Lord Stannis had closed the isle.
2016-07-07 00:40fileHer name was Shireen.
2016-07-07 00:40file"Maester Pylos, do me a kindness and bring the bird down from the rookery for the Lady Shireen ."
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "I had bad dreams,” Shireen told him.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Shireen was unconvinced.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Shireen gave a brave little nod.
2016-07-07 00:40fileShireen was a summer child, and had never known true cold.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Shireen giggled.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Shireen gave a cry of delight.
2016-07-07 00:40file"This is the Lady Shireen,” he told the raven.
2016-07-07 00:40fileShireen seemed to grow smaller.
2016-07-07 00:40fileThe king — the old king, Aerys II Targaryen, who had not been quite so mad in those days — had sent his lordship to seek a bride for Prince Rhaegar, who had no sisters to wed.
2016-07-07 00:40fileRobert will be delighted with him, and perhaps in time he will even teach Stannis how to laugh ."
2016-07-07 00:40fileNo one had ever taught Stannis how to laugh, least of all the boy Patchface.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "Maester, Ser Davos returned last night.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "Davos.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > There was a time when Lord Stannis would have woken him, no matter the hour, to have him there to give his counsel.

2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Shireen and Patchface followed them out, but the child soon grew restless with the old man’s creeping pace and dashed ahead, the fool lurching after her with his cowbells clanging madly.

2016-07-07 00:40fileLord Stannis would be found in the Chamber of the Painted Table, atop the Stone Drum, Dragonstone’s central keep, so named for the way its ancient walls boomed and rumbled during storms.
2016-07-07 00:40fileBut Lord Stannis would not think to come to him, so the maester resigned himself to the ordeal.
2016-07-07 00:40fileHe had stopped to catch his breath and ease the pain in his hip when he heard the scuff of boots on stone, and came face-to-face with Ser Davos Seaworth, descending.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Davos was a slight man, his low birth written plain upon a common face.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "Ser Davos,” the maester said.
2016-07-07 00:40fileIt was said that no one had ever handled a ship by night half so well as Davos Shorthand.
2016-07-07 00:40fileBefore Lord Stannis had knighted him, he had been the most notorious and elusive smuggler in all the Seven Kingdoms.
2016-07-07 00:40fileTo them I’ll always be the Onion Knight ."
2016-07-07 00:40fileHis left hand closed, stubby fingers locking into a fist; Stannis had hacked the ends off at the last joint, all but the thumb.
2016-07-07 00:40fileThe others — well, Beric Dondarrion is gone missing, some say dead, and Lord Caron is with Renly.
2016-07-07 00:40fileLoras Tyrell’s their Lord Commander ."
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > It was just the sort of notion that would appeal to Renly Baratheon; a splendid new order of knighthood, with gorgeous new raiment to proclaim it.
2016-07-07 00:40fileEven as a boy, Renly had loved bright colors and rich fabrics, and he had loved his games as well.
2016-07-07 00:40file< emphasis > Oh, Renly, Renly, dear sweet child, do you know what you are doing?
2016-07-07 00:40file< / emphasis > "What reasons did the lords give for their refusals ?" he asked Ser Davos.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "Only the false sort, and I’d not do that,” Davos said.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Maester Cressen remembered the day Davos had been knighted, after the siege of Storm’s End.
2016-07-07 00:40fileLord Stannis and a small garrison had held the castle for close to a year, against the great host of the Lords Tyrell and Redwyne.
2016-07-07 00:40fileCloaked in that darkness, Davos the smuggler had dared the Redwyne cordon and the rocks of Shipbreaker Bay alike.
2016-07-07 00:40fileLittle enough, yet it had kept the garrison alive long enough for Eddard Stark to reach Storm’s End and break the siege.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Lord Stannis had rewarded Davos with choice lands on Cape Wrath, a small keep, and a knight’s honors.
2016-07-07 00:40fileDavos had submitted, on the condition that Stannis wield the knife himself; he would accept no punishment from lesser hands.
2016-07-07 00:40fileAfterward, Davos had chosen the name Seaworth for his new-made house, and he took for his banner a black ship on a pale grey field — with an onion on its sails.
2016-07-07 00:40fileThe onetime smuggler was fond of saying that Lord Stannis had done him a boon, by giving him four less fingernails to clean and trim.
2016-07-07 00:40file"Ser Davos, truth can be a bitter draught, even for a man like Lord Stannis.
2016-07-07 00:40fileDavos held up his gloved hand.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Lord Stannis Baratheon’s refuge was a great round room with walls of bare black stone and four tall narrow windows that looked out to the four points of the compass.

2016-07-07 00:40fileIn the center of the chamber was the great table from which it took its name, a massive slab of carved wood fashioned at the command of Aegon Targaryen in the days before the Conquest.

2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Stannis Baratheon, Lord of Dragonstone and by the grace of the gods rightful heir to the Iron Throne of the Seven Kingdoms of Westeros, was broad of shoulder and sinewy of limb, with a tightness to his face and flesh that spoke of leather cured in the sun until it was as tough as steel.
2016-07-07 00:40file< emphasis > Hard < / emphasis > was the word men used when they spoke of Stannis, and hard he was.
2016-07-07 00:40fileHis brother, the late King Robert, had grown a beard in his final years.
2016-07-07 00:40fileAs if in answer, Stannis kept his own whiskers cropped tight and short.
2016-07-07 00:40fileSometimes when the world grew very still and silent of a night, Maester Cressen fancied he could hear Lord Stannis grinding his teeth half a castle away.
2016-07-07 00:40fileStannis had never learned to soften his speech, to dissemble or flatter; he said what he thought, and those that did not like it could be damned.
2016-07-07 00:40file"I knew you’d learn what Davos had to say soon enough.
2016-07-07 00:40file"I met Davos on the stair ."
2016-07-07 00:40fileThe bold ones have already declared for Renly.
2016-07-07 00:40fileFor < emphasis > Renly < / emphasis > < emphasis >!
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "< emphasis > His < / emphasis >,” Stannis broke in, "when by rights they should be mine.
2016-07-07 00:40fileI built his fleet and did his work, dutiful as a younger brother should be to an elder, as Renly should be to me.
2016-07-07 00:40fileHe names me Lord of Dragonstone, and gives Storm’s End and its incomes to < emphasis > Renly < / emphasis >.
2016-07-07 00:40fileStorm’s End belonged to House Baratheon for three hundred years; by rights it should have passed to me when Robert took the Iron Throne ."

2016-07-07 00:40fileHere was the heart of his lord’s weakness; for Dragonstone, old and strong though it was, commanded the allegiance of only a handful of lesser lords, whose stony island holdings were too thinly peopled to yield up the men that Stannis needed.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "Robert did you an injustice,” Maester Cressen replied carefully, "yet he had sound reasons.
2016-07-07 00:40fileHe needed a man’s strength to rule here, and Renly was but a child ."
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "He is a child still,” Stannis declared, his anger ringing loud in the empty hall, "a thieving child who thinks to snatch the crown off my brow.
2016-07-07 00:40fileWhat has Renly ever done to earn a throne?
2016-07-07 00:40fileHe sits in council and jests with Littlefinger, and at tourneys he dons his splendid suit of armor and allows himself to be knocked off his horse by a better man.
2016-07-07 00:40fileThat is the sum of my brother Renly, who thinks he ought to be a king.
2016-07-07 00:40fileWho maesters for Renly?
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "It would surprise me if Lord Renly sought counsel, Your Grace ."
2016-07-07 00:40fileIn that, as in so much else, Renly was like his brother Robert, and utterly unlike Stannis.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "< emphasis > Your Grace < / emphasis >,” Stannis repeated bitterly.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "I will not treat with Renly,” Stannis answered in a tone that brooked no argument.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "Not Renly, then,” the maester yielded.
2016-07-07 00:40fileEddard Stark’s son has been proclaimed King in the North, with all the power of Winterfell and Riverrun behind him ."
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "A green boy,” said Stannis, "and another false king.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "Why should I avenge Eddard Stark?
2016-07-07 00:40fileOh, < emphasis > Robert < / emphasis > loved him, to be sure.
2016-07-07 00:40file< emphasis > I < / emphasis > was his brother, not Ned Stark, but you would never have known it by the way he treated me.
2016-07-07 00:40fileI held Storm’s End for him, watching good men starve while Mace Tyrell and Paxter Redwyne feasted within sight of my walls.
2016-07-07 00:40fileDid Robert thank me?
2016-07-07 00:40file< / emphasis > No, he blamed me for letting Willem Darry steal away Viserys and the babe, as if I could have stopped it.
2016-07-07 00:40fileI sat on his council for fifteen years, helping Jon Arryn rule his realm while Robert drank and whored, but when Jon died, did my brother name me his Hand?
2016-07-07 00:40fileNo, he went galloping off to his dear friend Ned Stark, and offered him the honor.
2016-07-07 00:40fileShe has a young son, Jon Arryn’s heir.
2016-07-07 00:40fileIf you were to betroth Shireen to him —" < / p >
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "The boy is weak and sickly,” Lord Stannis objected.
2016-07-07 00:40fileService as a page might have done him good, but that damnable Lannister woman had Lord Arryn poisoned before it could be done, and now Lysa hides him in the Eyrie.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "Then you must send Shireen to the Eyrie,” the maester urged.
2016-07-07 00:40fileStannis furrowed his brow in thought.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Lord Stannis scowled.
2016-07-07 00:40fileLady Selyse was as tall as her husband, thin of body and thin of face, with prominent ears, a sharp nose, and the faintest hint of a mustache on her upper lip.
2016-07-07 00:40file"Lady Arryn owes you her allegiance, as do the Starks, your brother Renly, and all the rest.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "Your god can keep his grace,” said Lord Stannis, who did not share his wife’s fervent new faith.
2016-07-07 00:40fileStannis had always been uncomfortable around women, even his own wife.
2016-07-07 00:40fileWhen he had gone to King’s Landing to sit on Robert’s council, he had left Selyse on Dragonstone with their daughter.
2016-07-07 00:40fileIt was said that Stannis knew the strength of every house in the Seven Kingdoms.
2016-07-07 00:40fileThe Florent lands lie too close to Highgarden for your lord uncle to risk Mace Tyrell’s wrath ."
2016-07-07 00:40fileLady Selyse moved closer.
2016-07-07 00:40fileYou are meant to sail from this desolate rock as Aegon the Conqueror once sailed, to sweep all before you as he did.
2016-07-07 00:40fileStannis demanded again.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "Davos would tell you different,” Stannis said.
2016-07-07 00:40file"Those swords are sworn to Renly.
2016-07-07 00:40fileThey love my charming young brother, as they once loved Robert.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "Yes,” she answered, "but if Renly should die.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Stannis looked at his lady with narrowed eyes, until Cressen could not hold his tongue.
2016-07-07 00:40fileYour Grace, whatever follies Renly has committed —" < / p >
2016-07-07 00:40fileStannis turned back to his wife.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "Melisandre has gazed into the flames, and seen him dead ."
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Lady Selyse gave him a measured look.
2016-07-07 00:40fileHow he might win half a kingdom if he goes to the Starks on his knees and sells our daughter to Lysa Arryn ?"
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "I have heard your counsel, Cressen,” Lord Stannis said.
2016-07-07 00:40fileRobert, Stannis, Renly.
2016-07-07 00:40fileNot the Lady Selyse, the < emphasis > other < / emphasis > one.
2016-07-07 00:40file"Melisandre.
2016-07-07 00:40fileMelisandre of Asshai, sorceress, shadowbinder, and priestess to R’hllor, the Lord of Light, the Heart of Fire, the God of Flame and Shadow.
2016-07-07 00:40fileMelisandre, whose madness must not be allowed to spread beyond Dragonstone.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > And this very night Lord Stannis would feast his bannermen, his lady wife.
2016-07-07 00:40file. and the red woman, Melisandre of Asshai.
2016-07-07 00:40file< / emphasis > He was always summoned for feasts, seated near the salt, close to Lord Stannis.
2016-07-07 00:40fileWhatever he did, Robert had done first, and better.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "Maester,” said Lady Melisandre, her deep voice flavored with the music of the Jade Sea.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "A man your age must look to where he steps,” Melisandre said courteously.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "Now here is a riddle,” Melisandre said.
2016-07-07 00:40fileMelisandre turned from him in a swirl of red silk and made her way back to the high table, where King Stannis and his queen were seated.
2016-07-07 00:40fileOnly Ser Davos dressed simply, in brown doublet and green wool mantle, and only Ser Davos met his gaze, with pity in his eyes.
2016-07-07 00:40file< emphasis > Stannis, my lord, my sad sullen boy, son I never had, you must not do this, don’t you know how I have cared for you, lived for you, loved you despite all?
2016-07-07 00:40fileYes, loved you, better than Robert even, or Renly, for you were the one unloved, the one who needed me most < / emphasis > < emphasis >.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Ser Davos rose from the bench.
2016-07-07 00:40fileLord Stannis turned away to say something to Melisandre, who had seated herself at his right hand, in the place of high honor.
2016-07-07 00:40fileLady Selyse was on his left, flashing a smile as bright and brittle as her jewels.
2016-07-07 00:40file< emphasis > Too far < / emphasis >, Cressen thought dully, looking at where Ser Davos was seated.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Patchface was capering about as the maester made his slow way around the table to Davos Seaworth.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Ser Davos moved aside to make room on the bench.
2016-07-07 00:40fileThe red woman has seen victory in her flames, so Stannis means to press his claim, no matter what the numbers.
2016-07-07 00:40file"Lord Stannis ."
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Stannis turned from the red woman, but it was Lady Selyse who replied.
2016-07-07 00:40file"< emphasis > King < / emphasis > Stannis.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "I make common cause with no one,” Stannis Baratheon said.
2016-07-07 00:40fileLady Selyse took his hand.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Stannis nodded.
2016-07-07 00:40fileIf only he could somehow approach Melisandre unseen.

2016-07-07 00:40file"You are the rightful heir to your brother Robert, the true Lord of the Seven Kingdoms, and King of the Andals, the Rhoynar, and the First Men,” he said desperately, "but even so, you cannot hope to triumph without allies ."
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "He has an ally,” Lady Selyse said.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "Yes,” Lady Selyse agreed.
2016-07-07 00:40file"Perhaps he ought sing his counsel henceforth,” Lady Selyse said.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "You go too far, woman,” Lord Stannis said.
2016-07-07 00:40fileDavos saw, but no one else, he was certain.
2016-07-07 00:40fileLady Melisandre, will you share a cup of wine with me?
2016-07-07 00:40fileDavos clutched at him as he left the bench, catching his sleeve with the fingers that Lord Stannis had shortened.
2016-07-07 00:40fileMelisandre of Asshai took the cup from his hands and drank long and deep.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > At Winterfell they had called her "Arya Horseface" and she’d thought nothing could be worse, but that was before the orphan boy Lommy Greenhands had named her "Lumpyhead ."
2016-07-07 00:40fileWhen Yoren had dragged her into that alley she’d thought he meant to kill her, but the sour old man had only held her tight, sawing through her mats and tangles with his dagger.
2016-07-07 00:40file"I’m taking men and boys from the city,” Yoren growled as the sharp steel scraped at her head.
2016-07-07 00:40file"Lord Eddard gave me pick o" the dungeons, and I didn’t find no little lordlings down there.
2016-07-07 00:40fileThe Lannister guardsmen on the gate were stopping everyone, but Yoren called one by name and their wagons were waved through.
2016-07-07 00:40fileNo one spared Arya a glance.
2016-07-07 00:40fileArya never looked back.

2016-07-07 00:40fileShe wished the Rush would rise and wash the whole city away, Flea Bottom and the Red Keep and the Great Sept and < emphasis > everything < / emphasis >, and every<emphasis > one < / emphasis > too, especially Prince Joffrey and his mother.
2016-07-07 00:40fileBut she knew it wouldn’t, and anyhow Sansa was still in the city and would wash away too.
2016-07-07 00:40fileWhen she remembered that, Arya decided to wish for Winterfell instead.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Yoren was wrong about the pissing, though.
2016-07-07 00:40fileYoren had plucked some from the streets with promises of food for their bellies and shoes for their feet.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Yoren had taken grown men from the dungeons as well, thieves and poachers and rapers and the like.
2016-07-07 00:40fileTeams of plow horses pulled the wagons, and Yoren had bought two coursers and a half-dozen donkeys for the boys.
2016-07-07 00:40fileArya would have preferred a real horse, but the donkey was better than riding on a wagon.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Arya chewed her lip sullenly.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Arya hated them making fun of Needle.
2016-07-07 00:40fileJon Snow had given her Needle.
2016-07-07 00:40fileMaybe she had to let them call her Lumpyhead, but she wasn’t going to let them call Jon a thief.
2016-07-07 00:40file< emphasis > Yes I do < / emphasis >, Arya could have said.
2016-07-07 00:40fileYoren didn’t know about the stableboy, but she was afraid of what he might do if he found out.

2016-07-07 00:40fileArya was pretty sure that some of the other men were killers too, the three in the manacles for sure, but the queen wasn’t looking for < emphasis > them < / emphasis >, so it wasn’t the same.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Arya slid her practice sword from her belt.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Arya made the stick whistle as she laid the wood across his donkey’s hindquarters.
2016-07-07 00:40fileWhen Hot Pie began to wail, Arya whirled toward Lommy Greenhands, who was sitting on his donkey openmouthed.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > The Bull shouted, "Behind you,” and Arya spun.
2016-07-07 00:40fileArya slid into a water dancer’s stance and waited.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > By the time Yoren pulled her off him, Hot Pie was sprawled out on the ground with his breeches brown and smelly, crying as Arya whapped him over and over and over.
2016-07-07 00:40fileThe fat one snapped his pointy teeth together and hissed, but Arya ignored him.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Sullenly, Arya did as he said.
2016-07-07 00:40file< emphasis > I won’t < / emphasis >, Arya thought stubbornly, but when Yoren laid the wood against the back of her bare thighs, the shriek burst out of her anyway.
2016-07-07 00:40fileArya shrieked again, clutching the tree to keep from falling.
2016-07-07 00:40file"Might be I got your attention now,” Yoren said.
2016-07-07 00:40file< emphasis > They’re not my brothers < / emphasis >, Arya thought as she bent to yank up her breeches, but she knew better than to say so.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Yoren was looking at her.
2016-07-07 00:40file< emphasis > Calm as still water < / emphasis >, she told herself, the way Syrio Forel had taught her.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "I know,” Arya muttered sullenly.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "< emphasis > Joffrey < / emphasis >,” Arya breathed.
2016-07-07 00:40fileYoren tossed back her stick sword.
2016-07-07 00:40fileHot Pie was worse off; Yoren had to shift some barrels around so he could lie in the back of a wagon on some sacks of barley, and he whimpered every time the wheels hit a rock.
2016-07-07 00:40fileLommy Greenhands wasn’t even hurt, yet he stayed as far away from Arya as he could get.

2016-07-07 00:40fileWhen Arya squinted the right way she could see the sword too, only it wasn’t a new sword, it was Ice, her father’s greatsword, all ripply Valyrian steel, and the red was Lord Eddard’s blood on the blade after Ser Ilyn the King’s Justice had cut off his head.
2016-07-07 00:40fileYoren had made her look away when it happened, yet it seemed to her that the comet looked like Ice must have, after.
2016-07-07 00:40fileThe kingsroad wound its way past Winterfell on its way to the Wall, and Yoren had promised he’d leave her there with no one any wiser about who she’d been.
2016-07-07 00:40fileShe yearned to see her mother again, and Robb and Bran and Rickon.
2016-07-07 00:40file. but it was Jon Snow she thought of most.
2016-07-07 00:40fileShe wished somehow they could come to the Wall before Winterfell, so Jon might muss up her hair and call her "little sister ."
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > SANSA < / p >
2016-07-07 00:40fileSansa was watching it from her tower window when Ser Arys Oakheart arrived to escort her down to the tourney grounds.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "Glory to your betrothed,” Ser Arys answered at once.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Doubtless that was what they told Joffrey; Sansa was not so sure.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "King Joffrey sits where Aegon the Dragon once sat, in the castle built by his son,” Ser Arys said.
2016-07-07 00:40file< / emphasis > Her mother was one of Joffrey’s enemies now, her brother Robb another.
2016-07-07 00:40fileMust Robb and her lady mother die next?
2016-07-07 00:40fileThe comet was red, but Joffrey was Baratheon as much as Lannister, and their sigil was a black stag on a golden field.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Sansa closed the shutters and turned sharply away from the window.
2016-07-07 00:40file"You look very lovely today, my lady,” Ser Arys said.
2016-07-07 00:40fileKnowing that Joffrey would require her to attend the tourney in his honor, Sansa had taken special care with her face and clothes.
2016-07-07 00:40fileShe wore a gown of pale purple silk and a moonstone hair net that had been a gift from Joffrey.
2016-07-07 00:40fileWhen they told him that Robb had been proclaimed King in the North, his rage had been a fearsome thing, and he had sent Ser Boros to beat her.
2016-07-07 00:40fileSer Arys offered his arm and she let him lead her from her chamber.
2016-07-07 00:40fileIf she must have one of the Kingsguard dogging her steps, Sansa preferred that it be him.
2016-07-07 00:40fileArys Oakheart was courteous, and would talk to her cordially.
2016-07-07 00:40fileOnce he even objected when Joffrey commanded him to hit her.
2016-07-07 00:40file. except for the Hound, but Joff never asked the Hound to punish her.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Ser Arys had light-brown hair and a face that was not unpleasant to look upon.
2016-07-07 00:40fileSansa asked as they descended the steps arm in arm.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "I will,” Ser Arys answered, smiling.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > The last tourney had been different, Sansa reflected.
2016-07-07 00:40fileKing Robert had staged it in her father’s honor.
2016-07-07 00:40fileRobert Baratheon was dead, and her father as well, beheaded for a traitor on the steps of the Great Sept of Baelor.
2016-07-07 00:40fileSansa always felt safer when Cersei was there to restrain her son.
2016-07-07 00:40fileSer Arys dropped his voice.
2016-07-07 00:40file"Lord Tywin has gone to ground at Harrenhal instead of bringing his army to the city as the queen commanded.
2016-07-07 00:40fileSer Arys was fond of gossip, but only when he was certain that no one was listening.
2016-07-07 00:40filePrincess Myrcella and Prince Tommen sat behind him.
2016-07-07 00:40fileIn the back of the royal box, Sandor Clegane stood at guard, his hands resting on his swordbelt.
2016-07-07 00:40file"Lady Sansa,” the Hound announced curtly when he saw her.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Princess Myrcella nodded a shy greeting at the sound of Sansa’s name, but plump little Prince Tommen jumped up eagerly.
2016-07-07 00:40file"Sansa, did you hear?
2016-07-07 00:40fileTommen was all of eight.
2016-07-07 00:40fileHe reminded her of her own little brother, Bran.
2016-07-07 00:40fileBran was back at Winterfell, a cripple, yet safe.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Sansa would have given anything to be with him.
2016-07-07 00:40file"I fear for the life of your foeman,” she told Tommen solemnly.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Ser Arys bowed.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Joffrey waved a curt dismissal while he studied Sansa from head to heels.
2016-07-07 00:40fileSansa was relieved.

2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Dany took the warlock’s words well salted, but the magnificence of the great city was not to be denied.

2016-07-07 00:40file< p > In this city of splendors, Dany had expected the House of the Undying Ones to be the most splendid of all, but she emerged from her palanquin to behold a grey and ancient ruin.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Ser Jorah Mormont came up beside them.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "Some places even a < emphasis > khal < / emphasis > must walk alone,” Dany said.

2016-07-07 00:40file< / emphasis > Dany wondered.

2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "I do,” Dany said, suddenly decided.
2016-07-07 00:40fileDany took his arm nonetheless.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "I will do as you say,” Dany promised.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "The door to my right,” Dany repeated.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > When they reached the door — a tall oval mouth, set in a wall fashioned in the likeness of a human face — the smallest dwarf Dany had ever seen was waiting on the threshold.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Dany raised the glass to her lips.
2016-07-07 00:40fileDany put the glass back on the servitor’s tray, and went inside.
2016-07-07 00:40fileDany chose the rightmost, and entered a long, dim, high-ceilinged hall.
2016-07-07 00:40fileDany strode after him.
2016-07-07 00:40fileDany could hear sounds within the walls, a faint scurrying and scrabbling that made her think of rats.
2016-07-07 00:40fileDany hurried quickly past.
2016-07-07 00:40file< emphasis > I will not look < / emphasis >, Dany told herself, but the temptation was too strong.
2016-07-07 00:40fileHe wore an iron crown and held a leg of lamb in one hand as a king might hold a scepter, and his eyes followed Dany with mute appeal.
2016-07-07 00:40fileHis big wrinkled hand reached for her, soft as old leather, and Dany wanted to take it and hold it and kiss it, she wanted that as much as she had ever wanted anything.
2016-07-07 00:40fileDrogon lashed against her back, urging her on, and Dany ran until she could run no more.
2016-07-07 00:40fileDrogon shrieked, his claws digging through silk and skin, but the king on his throne never heard, and Dany moved on.
2016-07-07 00:40file< emphasis > Viserys < / emphasis >, was her first thought the next time she paused, but a second glance told her otherwise.
2016-07-07 00:40file"Aegon,” he said to a woman nursing a newborn babe in a great wooden bed.
2016-07-07 00:40fileDany looked back behind her.
2016-07-07 00:40file< / emphasis > Dany turned to the blank wall once more, but there was nothing.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Dany hesitated.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "Our little lives are no more than a flicker of a moth’s wing to them,” Dany said, remembering.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Dany left him behind, entering a stairwell.
2016-07-07 00:40file< / emphasis > Dany said a quick prayer, begging the Warrior for courage and the Dothraki horse god for strength.
2016-07-07 00:40file"Daenerys of House Targaryen, be welcome.
2016-07-07 00:40fileAs Dany walked to the empty chair at the foot of the table, they did not stir, nor speak, nor turn to face her.
2016-07-07 00:40file< / emphasis > Dany listened to the silence.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "I have come for the gift of truth,” Dany said.
2016-07-07 00:40fileThey wanted her, needed her, the fire, the life, and Dany gasped and opened her arms to give herself to them.
2016-07-07 00:40fileHer heart was pounding, racing, the hands and mouths were gone, heat washed over her skin, and Dany blinked at a sudden glare.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Dany pushed herself to her feet and bulled through them.

2016-07-07 00:40fileDany ran, searching for a door, a door to her right, a door to her left, any door, but there was nothing, only twisty stone walls, and a floor that seemed to move slowly under her feet, writhing as if to trip her.

2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "Listen,” Luwin said to Osha, "the princes.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "Then where ?" asked Osha.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "I will be,” Bran said, though it was hard.
2016-07-07 00:40file. your father’s son, Bran.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Osha gazed up at the weirwood, at the red face carved in the pale trunk.
2016-07-07 00:40fileShe turned to Meera.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Jojen and Meera led Rickon out between them.
2016-07-07 00:40fileHodor followed.
2016-07-07 00:40fileOsha joined them in the yard a few moments later.
2016-07-07 00:40file"Hodor must stay with Bran, to be his legs,” the wildling woman said briskly.
2016-07-07 00:40file"I will take Rickon with me ."
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "We’ll go with Bran,” said Jojen Reed.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "Aye, I thought you might,” said Osha.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "We’ll take the Hunter’s Gate,” said Meera.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > "Hodor,” said Hodor.
2016-07-07 00:40fileOsha found some loaves of burned bread that were still edible, and even a cold roast fowl that she ripped in half.
2016-07-07 00:40fileMeera unearthed a crock of honey and a big sack of apples.
2016-07-07 00:40fileRickon sobbed and clung to Hodor’s leg until Osha gave him a smack with the butt end of her spear.
2016-07-07 00:40fileThe last Bran saw of them was the direwolf’s tail as it vanished behind the broken tower.
2016-07-07 00:40fileBran asked as they crossed the drawbridge between the walls.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > Meera looked to her brother for the answer.
2016-07-07 00:40file"Our road is north,” Jojen announced.
2016-07-07 00:40file< p > At the edge of the wolfswood, Bran turned in his basket for one last glimpse of the castle that had been his life.

2016-07-07 00:40file< emphasis > The stone is strong < / emphasis >, Bran told himself, < emphasis > the roots of the trees go deep, and under the ground the Kings of Winter sit their thrones < / emphasis > < emphasis >.

2016-07-07 00:40fileWhen Robert Baratheon met Rhaegar Targaryen on the Trident, the Freys did not arrive until the battle was done, and thereafter Lord Hoster Tully always called Lord Walder "the Late Lord Frey ."

2016-07-07 00:40fileLord Frey agreed to support the cause of the King in the North only after Robb Stark agreed to a betrothal, promising to marry one of his daughters or granddaughters after the war was done.
2016-07-07 00:40fileLord Walder has known ninety-one name days, but only recently took his eighth wife, a girl seventy years his junior.
